newsitem.title: USA: CME registers record open interest ahead of FOMC.
newsitem.headline: CME registers record open interest ahead of FOMC.

text.p: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange said it set four consecutive open interest records last week as market participants positioned themselves ahead of the May 20 Federal Open Market Committee meeting.

Total open positions climbed from a record 7,257,167 to a record 7,385,827 positions in the four sessions up to May 15. In addition, currency trading on the GLOBEX electronic system reached a record 8,572 contracts Wednesday, the exchange said.
Average daily volume in currency trading on GLOBEX is up 111 percent for the year to date, and total CME GLOBEX volume is up 86 percent.
Overall, average daily volume is up 10.5 percent for the year, the exchange said.
